author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Sujato Bhikkhu

segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4
3. At Uruvelā
24. At Kāḷaka’s Monastery

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sākete viharati kāḷakārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāketa, in Kāḷaka’s monastery.
There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
“Mendicants!”
“Venerable sir,” they replied.
The Buddha said this:

segments.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ mutaṃ viññātaṃ pattaṃ pariyesitaṃ anuvicaritaṃ manasā, tamahaṃ jānāmi.
segments.en: “In this world—with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—whatever is seen, heard, thought, cognized, searched, and explored by the mind: that I know.

segments.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ mutaṃ viññātaṃ pattaṃ pariyesitaṃ anuvicaritaṃ manasā, tamahaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ.
segments.en: In this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—whatever is seen, heard, thought, cognized, searched, and explored by the mind: that I have insight into.

segments.pli: Taṃ tathāgatassa viditaṃ, taṃ tathāgato na upaṭṭhāsi.
segments.en: That has been known by a Realized One, but a Realized One is not subject to it.

segments.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ mutaṃ viññātaṃ pattaṃ pariyesitaṃ anuvicaritaṃ manasā, tamahaṃ na jānāmīti vadeyyaṃ, taṃ mamassa musā.
segments.en: If I were to say that ‘I do not know … the world with its gods’, I would be lying.

segments.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave … pe … tamahaṃ jānāmi ca na ca jānāmīti vadeyyaṃ, tampassa tādisameva.
segments.en: If I were to say that ‘I both know and do not know … the world with its gods’, that would be just the same.

segments.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave … pe … tamahaṃ neva jānāmi na na jānāmīti vadeyyaṃ, taṃ mamassa kali.
segments.en: If I were to say that ‘I neither know nor do not know … the world with its gods’, that would be my fault.

segments.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, tathāgato daṭṭhā daṭṭhabbaṃ, diṭṭhaṃ na maññati, adiṭṭhaṃ na maññati, daṭṭhabbaṃ na maññati, daṭṭhāraṃ na maññati;
segments.en: So a Realized One sees what’s to be seen, but does not conceive what’s seen, does not conceive what’s unseen, does not conceive what’s to be seen, and does not conceive a seer.

segments.pli: sutvā sotabbaṃ, sutaṃ na maññati, asutaṃ na maññati, sotabbaṃ na maññati, sotāraṃ na maññati;
segments.en: He hears what’s to be heard, but does not conceive what’s heard, does not conceive what’s unheard, does not conceive what’s to be heard, and does not conceive a hearer.

segments.pli: mutvā motabbaṃ, mutaṃ na maññati, amutaṃ na maññati, motabbaṃ na maññati, motāraṃ na maññati;
segments.en: He thinks what’s to be thought, but does not conceive what’s thought, does not conceive what’s not thought, does not conceive what’s to be thought, and does not conceive a thinker.

segments.pli: viññatvā viññātabbaṃ, viññātaṃ na maññati, aviññātaṃ na maññati, viññātabbaṃ na maññati, viññātāraṃ na maññati.
segments.en: He knows what’s to be known, but does not conceive what’s known, does not conceive what’s unknown, does not conceive what’s to be known, and does not conceive a knower.

segments.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, tathāgato diṭṭhasutamutaviññātabbesu dhammesu tādīyeva tādī.
segments.en: Since a Realized One is poised in the midst of things seen, heard, thought, and known, he is the poised one.

segments.pli: ‘Tamhā ca pana tādimhā añño tādī uttaritaro vā paṇītataro vā natthī’ti vadāmīti.
segments.en: And I say that there is no-one who has better or finer poise than this.

segments.pli: Yaṃ kiñci diṭṭhaṃva sutaṃ mutaṃ vā,
segments.en: The poised one does not take anything
seen, heard, or thought to be ultimately true or false.
But others get attached, thinking it’s the truth,
limited by their preconceptions.
Since they’ve already seen this dart,
to which people are attached and cling,
they say, ‘I know, I see, that’s how it is’;
the Realized Ones have no attachments.”

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāketa,…

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha knows what can be known, and remains poised in the midst of the world.
